thread.title: Security beefed up for India-SA ODI tomorrow
thread.title_full: Security beefed up for India-SA ODI tomorrow

author: Indore
title: Security beefed up for India-SA ODI tomorrow
text:
Security beefed up for India-SA ODI tomorrow Indore, Oct 13, 2015 (PTI) Tight security arrangements have been made for second One-Day International between India and South Africa to be played at Holkar stadium here tomorrow.
A security blanket of 1,500 personnel, including jawans of police, Rapid Action Force (RAF) and Special Armed Forces (SAF) of Madhya Pradesh, will guard the stadium, Indore police range Deputy Inspector General (DIG) Santosh Kumar Singh said.
He also said commandos of Counter Terrorists Group (CTG) will be stationed near the venue.
The DIG said that a four-tier security cover will be put in place in and around the stadium.
Spectators are going to be frisked at the entrance of the stadium, Singh said adding that 17 CCTV cameras will keep a hawk's eye on the movements at the ground.
The district administration has banned spectators to carry water bottles inside the stadium.
